description: This course focuses on developing and advancing students’ verbal and aural communication skills needed in academic settings. Main areas covered in class include: academic listening, critical thinking, critical listening, listening strategies applications and lecture note taking skills. During this semester, students will listen to and watch a variety of authentic visual and audio materials on various topics. In addition, the course seeks to develop students’ English discussion abilities and verbal communication skills in academic settings.

**ADVANCED LISTENING—Spring Semester 2019**

**Instructor:**  Jean E. Curran, Office: 誠714

**Office Hours:** Tuesdays, 16:30 – 18:20; Wednesdays, 16:30 – 18:20    

**Email: curran.jean@gmail.com**

Goals  
  
The goal of this course is to build upon the listening skills you have developed in both your basic and intermediate listening classes. These skills include predicting, listening for the main idea, listening for details, critical listening, and vocabulary development. During the course we will listen and watch a variety of authentic materials. A particular focus this year will be the development of notetaking skills for academic lectures.  
  
Requirements  
  
1\. Attendance and Preparation  
It is very important that you attend class on a regular basis and that you prepare the necessary homework assignments. If you are absent for class on more than two occasions, you will fail the course. Please arrive for class on time. If you are late, points will be deducted from your final grade for the course.  
  
2\. Participation  
Although this class focuses on the development of listening skills, it is also expected that you will be an active participant in the learning process. You should be a critical listener, and contribute to any classroom discussions of the listening topics. 3. Listening—Outside the Classroom  
You will be asked to listen to an English program, news broadcast, part of a lecture, film, etc. each week, and write a journal about the program you have listened to. You will be asked to make a listening contract to determine the number of listening journals you will complete this semester. See handout for detailed guidelines.   
  
Contacting your Instructor: Office hours, Tuesdays, 16:30 - 18:20 and Wednesdays, 16:30 - 18:20, or by appointment. If you prefer to contact me by email, on your message please indicate your name, student number, that you are a student in Advanced Listening, and your concern or question.
